sen.j: 奥沢栄助（おくざわ えいすけ、生年不詳－元治元年6月5日 (旧暦)(1864年7月8日)）は、新選組隊士。
sen.e: Eisuke OKUZAWA (male, ? to July 8, 1864) was a member of Shinsengumi.
Eisuke OKUZAWA (male, ? to July 8, 1864) was a member of Shinsengumi.
Eisuke OKUZAWA (the date of birth unknown - July 8, 1864) was a member of Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: male,削除。the date of birth unknown - 補足しました。？to削除。

sen.e: It is unknown from which clan he was from.
It is unknown from which clan he was from.
It is unknown from which clan he was from.

sen.j: 池田屋事件の際、局長近藤勇の隊に所属して池田屋に突入し、重傷を負い、屯所にて死亡。
sen.e: When Ikeda-ya incident happened, OKUZAWA belonged to the troop led by the leader, Isami KONDO of Shinsengumi, rushed into Ikeda-ya with them, was seriously injured, and died at a stationing facility of Shinsengumi.

When the Ikeda-ya incident happened, OKUZAWA, who belonged to the troops led by Isami KONDO of Shinsengumi, rushed into Ikeda-ya with them, was seriously injured, and died at a stationing facility of Shinsengumi.

When the Ikeda-ya incident happened, Okizawa, who belonged to the troops led by Isami KONDO of Shinsengumi, rushed into Ikeda-ya with them, was seriously injured, and died at a stationing facility of Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 会津藩は功労金20両を奥沢に与えている。
sen.e: Aizu clan gave award money of 20 ryo to OKUZAWA.
Aizu clan gave a reward of 20 ryo to OKUZAWA.
Aizu clan gave a reward of 20 ryo to Okuzawa.
OKUZAWA's grave was in Ninsho-ji temple.
OKUZAWA's grave is located in Ninsho-ji temple.
Okuzawa's grave is located in Mibu-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: Okuzawaとしました。壬生寺→Mibu-dera Temple
